void icmAbortRead ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Addr  address 
)

When called in a memory read callback, indicates that the read has been aborted.

Parameters:
processor The current processor.
address The bad address.
void icmAbortWrite ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Addr  address 
)

When called in a memory write callback, indicates that the write has been aborted.

Parameters:
processor The current processor or null.
address The bad address.
void icmAddNetCallback ( icmNetP  net,
icmNetFn  cb,
void *  userData 
)

Install a callback which will occur when a net is written.

Parameters:
net The net object.
cb Address of function to be called.
userData User data passed to callback.
void icmAddPortMapCB ( icmPseP  pse,
const char *  port,
icmPsePortMapFn  cb,
void *  user 
)

Ask for notification when a PSE maps an address port.

Parameters:
pse The PSE.
port The PSE port name.
cb The callback.
user User Data.
Bool icmAdvanceTime ( icmTime  time  ) 

Advance time processing any pending events due in the period. This will cause PSEs and other timed models to process any pending events or delays. The amount that time is advanced, vs. the number of instructions that each processor executes, sets the effective processor speeds.

Returns:
Returns True if simulation must continue, False if finish requested.
Parameters:
time The new ABSOLUTE time (this is not relative).
Bool icmAdvanceTimeDouble ( double  time  ) 

Advance time processing any pending events due in the period. This is the same as icmAdvanceTime(), but takes a double (less precision). This is used by the TLM integration (TLM uses double in MSVC).

Returns:
Returns True if simulation must continue, False if finish requested.
Parameters:
time The new ABSOLUTE time (this is not relative).
void icmBridgeBuses ( icmBusP  slave,
icmBusP  master,
Addr  lowAddrSlave,
Addr  highAddrSlave,
Addr  lowAddrMaster 
)

Create dynamic bridge (not for static platforms).

Parameters:
slave Bus with slave port; region which gets addressed.
master Bus with master port; region which acts as a bus master.
lowAddrSlave The lower end of the slave region.
highAddrSlave The higher end of the slave region.
lowAddrMaster The lower end of the master region.
const char* icmCallCommand ( const char *  modelInstanceName,
const char *  pluginInstanceName,
const char *  command,
Uns32  argc,
const char **  argv 
)

Call a command that was installed in an Intercept object or model.

Returns:
The result string, or null.
Parameters:
modelInstanceName Instance name of processor or PSE.
pluginInstanceName Instance name of plugin (intercept object). Zero if the command is in the model.
command Name of the command.
argc Number of args to the command, plus one for the command name.
argv Array of string arguments. The first element should be the command name.
void icmCancelTrigger ( icmTriggerEventP  event  ) 

Cancel the trigger event (before it triggers).

Parameters:
event The event.
void icmExit ( icmProcessorP  processor  ) 

Terminate execution of the current processor and return immediately from icmSimulate with icmStopReason ICM_SR_EXIT (typically used within icmMemReadFn or icmMemWriteFn callback).

Parameters:
processor The processor that was running.
void icmFinish ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Int32  status 
)

Terminate execution of the current processor and return immediately from icmSimulate with icmStopReason ICM_SR_FINISH (typically used within icmMemReadFn or icmMemWriteFn callback).

Parameters:
processor The processor that was running, or null.
status Status code.
void icmFlushMemory ( icmMemoryP  memory,
Addr  lowAddr,
Addr  highAddr 
)

Inform the simulator that the memory range lowAddr:highAddr has been modified.

Parameters:
memory Memory object.
lowAddr Low address of range to flush.
highAddr High address of range to flush.
void icmFlushProcessorMemory ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Addr  lowAddr,
Addr  highAddr 
)

Inform a processor that it's code memory has been updated.

Parameters:
processor Processor object.
lowAddr Lower extent of modified memory.
highAddr Upper extent of modified memory.
icmTime icmGetCurrentTime ( void   ) 

Get the current simulated time.

Returns:
Current simulation time (see icmTime).
Int32 icmGetStatus ( void   ) 

Return the finish status, if simulation was explicitly finished.

Returns:
Status, or zero if simulation was not explicitly finished.
icmStopReason icmGetStopReason ( icmProcessorP  processor  ) 

Return the stopReason for a specific processor.

Returns:
Reason why the simulation stopped (see icmStopReason enumerated type).
Parameters:
processor Processor object.
void icmHalt ( icmProcessorP  processor  ) 

Halt execution of the current processor and return immediately from icmSimulate with icmStopReason ICM_SR_HALT (typically used within icmMemReadFn or icmMemWriteFn callback).

Parameters:
processor The processor that was running.
Bool icmInFetchContext ( icmProcessorP  processor  ) 

When called in a memory read callback, indicates whether the current context is a fetch (True) or a load (False) (deprecated - use isFetch argument to icmMemReadFn instead).

Returns:
Whether context is a fetch.
Parameters:
processor The current processor.
void icmLoadModelHook ( const char *  modelFile,
const char *  modelSymbol 
)

This hook function is called just after each model is loaded - set a breakpoint on this to get control just after each model is loaded (allowing further breakpoints to be set in model code if required).

Parameters:
modelFile The name of model file being loaded.
modelSymbol The entry symbol in the model being loaded.

Returns:
True if access was successful.
Parameters:
proc Processor object or null.
bus Bus object.
simAddress Offset from base of memory.
buffer Pointer to space the receive the data.
size Number of bytes to transfer.

True if access was successful.
Parameters:

simAddress Offset from base of memory.

size Number of bytes to transfer.
Bool icmReadProcessorMemory ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Addr  simAddress,
void *  buffer,
Uns32  bytes 
)

Read a region from the processor address space into native memory.

Returns:
True if access was successful.
Parameters:
processor Processor object.
simAddress Base address of the region to be read.
buffer Pointer to space to receive the data.
bytes Number of bytes to transfer.
void icmSetPSEdiagnosticLevel ( icmPseP  pse,
Uns32  level 
)

Set PSE diagnostic level. This sets the return value of the deprecated bhmGetDiagnosticLevel and also causes the PSEs 'setDiagnosticLevel' function to be called if one was installed.

Parameters:
pse The PSE.
level The new diagnostic level. Usually 0-4, but see the peripheral modeling guide.
icmStopReason icmSimulate ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Uns64  instructions 
)

Perform simulation of a specific processor for a number of instructions.

Returns:
Why it stopped (see icmStopReason enumerated type).
Parameters:
processor The processor object.
instructions Maximum number of instruction to simulate.
icmProcessorP icmSimulatePlatform ( void   ) 

Simulate the platform using the default scheduling scheme, using time slice and stop time set by icmSetSimulationTimeSlice and icmSetSimulationStopTime.

Returns:
The processor that has caused simulation to stop, or null if no processor has caused simulation to stop (e.g. the stop time has been reached). The reason why a processor caused simulation to stop can be found using icmGetStopReason.
void icmSimulationEnding ( void   ) 

This can be called just as simulation is about to end, in order to activate PSE end-of-simulation code. It is not required if icmSimulatePlatform() is used.

void icmSimulationStarting ( void   ) 

This can be called after platform construction and before any processor or PSE is due to run. It is not required if icmSimulatePlatform() or icmSimulateProcessor() is used. It must be called if a platform has no processors (just PSEs) or if PSEs are activated before processors.

void icmTerminate ( void   ) 

Terminate ICM package - call this at end of simulation.

icmTriggerEventP icmTriggerAfter ( icmTime  delay,
icmTriggerFn  cb,
void *  user 
)

Call a function after a given (simulated) time interval.

Returns:
An event handle which can be used to cancel the event (before it triggers).
Parameters:
delay Delay in microseconds.
cb Address of function to call.
user Data passed to the callback.
void icmUnbridgeBuses ( icmBusP  bus,
Addr  lowAddr,
Addr  highAddr 
)

Remove a dynamic bridge. See icmBridgeBuses().

Parameters:
bus Bus with slave port; this generates the addresses.
lowAddr The lower end of the slave region.
highAddr The higher end of the slave region.

)

Bool icmWriteProcessorMemory ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Addr  simAddress,
const void *  buffer,
Uns32  bytes 
)

Write a region from native memory into processor address.

Returns:
True if access was successful.
Parameters:
processor Processor object.
simAddress Base address of the region to be written.
buffer Pointer to space containing the data.
bytes Number of bytes to transfer.
void icmYield ( icmProcessorP  processor  ) 

Suspend execution of the passed processor (this may be the current processor) and return immediately from icmSimulate with icmStopReason ICM_SR_YIELD (typically used within icmMemReadFn or icmMemWriteFn callback). As with all other ICM functions this should not be called from a signal handler to interrupt simulation (see icmInterrupt for this purpose).

Parameters:
processor The processor that was running.
